tabs.content: ++A selection of past-funded 'Scale-Up Hubs':++,++What this means:++,++How is the Fund 8 challenge different?++,While the growing demand is showing us that the need is there, our focus for the next challenge should be on the other side of the coin. ,While the facts have proven the necessity of a Community Hubs challenge, there are many other equally as important challenges vying for a position in Fund 8, so we must act accordingly. ,While we are ,When we approach hubs from the lens of information-delivery nodes, we can build a hub taxonomy within a need-impact matrix and then find the most capital efficient model for each location.,In simpler terms, consider why a hub exists, in the context of it's location, access to infrastructure and community readiness. Then design a hub according to those factors, with a traditional brick-and-mortar (CTH) being only one out of many potential information-delivery systems within a local community.

tabs.title: This round will focus much more on 'minimum-viable hubs' (MVHs)
++Additional Success Metrics:++
tabs.content:
Is the hub's Fund 8 proposal in keeping with the MVH principle?
	Do they have an understanding of their target audience?
	Can they accurately project their reach (physical and online) in the first 3, 6, 12 months?
	Can they accurately project the number of onboarded members to the hub in 3, 6, 12 months?
	Have they given an indication of a financial sustainability model?
	Have they given an indication of budget costs vs 'cost to launch'? (eg. A CTH may only apply for 1/5 of their cost to launch due to the demand pressures of acquiring catalyst funding)

tabs.title: ++Ratings by CAs and Voters should favour:++
tabs.content:
---------------

Proposals that have a budget:cost-to-launch ratio between 1-1.5.
	Proposals that do not exceed 5% of the total Challenge budget.
	Proposals that account for local needs and infrastructure concerns.
	Proposals that show creativity and ingenuity around hub design and information delivery.
	Proposals that are using local, recyclable materials and have a commitment to sustainability practices.

tabs.title: Why is it important?
tabs.content: Without users on the ground level, we are building niche products serving mostly technical people with blockchain expertise.

tabs.title: What does success look like?
tabs.content: Local Community Hubs across the world where the average person can take part in their own language and with their own cultural understanding

tabs.title: Key Metrics to measure
tabs.content:
How many new Hubs were launched in 2022?
	How many developers did this community-focused challenge bring into the Cardano ecosystem?
	How many new users of Cardano were onboarded?
	What was the total reach of the Hub's initial marketing launch?
	How many external organizations did this community-focused challenge bring into the Cardano ecosystem?
